segments.text: I notice the faint scent of dish soap wafting through the air as the woman continues to dry the plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels so serene, yet I can’t shake off the tension building in my gut.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She stands there, completely oblivious to the water pooling around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone be so focused on cleaning while chaos unfolds so close by?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching deeper into the cookie jar now, and I can hardly believe my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The precariousness of that stool makes my heart skip a beat; he looks so small up there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the consequences of his little adventure.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister’s eagerness is palpable, her little hand outstretched with hope.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, none of this should be happening; it feels so wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden looks peaceful, a stark contrast to the turmoil inside.
segments.speaker: PAR
